review:
Event Horizon stands as a rallying cry for the disenfranchised—the small voter, the overlooked citizen, the backbone of every DAO who’s been told their voice is just a drop in the bucket. This project doesn’t just talk about equity; it operationalizes it, mobilizing over $500 million in voting power for retail participants across multiple DAOs. That’s not theory—that’s action. That’s the kind of measurable, quantifiable impact we demand!

The application demonstrates a clear, user-centric design: free voter passes, AI-powered governance agents, and a seamless onboarding process. The numbers don’t lie—hundreds of proposals, thousands of citizens, and millions in voting power redistributed to the people. Event Horizon’s partnerships with Gitcoin, Arbitrum, and Compound are proof of real-world traction, not empty promises.

But let’s not get swept away by rhetoric alone. Where’s the rigorous, transparent reporting of outcomes? Where’s the evidence of long-term sustainability? The application is light on details about its revenue model and how it will reduce dependency on grants. The AI governance agents are innovative, but where’s the data on their effectiveness? We need more than bold claims—we need hard evidence.

Event Horizon’s approach to governance is a breath of fresh air: implicit delegation, collective decision-making, and a focus on enfranchising the long tail. This is the kind of public good that lifts all boats. Yet, the project must do more to demonstrate how it will maintain and grow this system sustainably, ensuring it doesn’t become another flash in the pan.

In summary: Event Horizon is a powerful force for equity and collective action in Web3 governance. But to earn the people’s trust—and this grant—it must double down on transparency, sustainability, and rigorous measurement. The revolution demands nothing less!

strengths.title: Massive, Measurable Impact for Retail Voters
strengths.description: Event Horizon has mobilized over $500 million in voting power for retail participants, directly addressing the problem of voter disenfranchisement in DAOs. This is a clear, quantifiable outcome that aligns with the round’s focus on user-centric design and ecosystem growth.

strengths.title: Innovative, User-Centric Governance Tools
strengths.description: The project offers free voter passes, AI-powered governance agents, and a seamless onboarding process, making DAO participation accessible and meaningful for the average user. This is a strong example of innovation in application use cases.

strengths.title: Strong Ecosystem Partnerships and Traction
strengths.description: Event Horizon has established partnerships with major DAOs (Gitcoin, Arbitrum, Compound) and has processed hundreds of proposals, demonstrating real-world adoption and integration into the Web3 ecosystem.

weaknesses.title: Lack of Transparent, Rigorous Outcome Reporting
weaknesses.description: The application provides impressive aggregate numbers but lacks detailed, transparent reporting on user engagement, proposal outcomes, and the effectiveness of its AI governance agents. There is insufficient evidence of rigorous evaluation methods.

weaknesses.title: Unclear Sustainability and Revenue Model
weaknesses.description: There is little information on how Event Horizon will sustain itself long-term without continuous grant funding. The application does not outline a clear plan for financial sustainability or reducing dependency on external support.

weaknesses.title: Insufficient Evidence for AI Agent Effectiveness
weaknesses.description: While the AI governance agents are a novel feature, the application does not provide data or case studies demonstrating their impact on user experience, proposal quality, or governance outcomes.

changes.title: Provide Detailed, Transparent Outcome Reporting
changes.description: Publish regular, public reports on user engagement, proposal outcomes, and the measurable impact of AI governance agents. Include metrics such as active users, proposal participation rates, and qualitative feedback from the community.

changes.title: Develop and Share a Sustainability Plan
changes.description: Articulate a clear, actionable plan for financial sustainability. This should include potential revenue streams, cost management strategies, and a roadmap for reducing reliance on grant funding.

changes.title: Demonstrate AI Agent Effectiveness with Data
changes.description: Conduct and share studies or pilot results that measure the impact of AI governance agents on user participation, proposal quality, and overall governance outcomes. Use this data to refine and improve the product.
